landing.title: CHILEANSPACE
landing.subtitle: Designing a sustainable future on Mars. Explore our innovative habitat concept, engineered for resilience and habitability on the Red Planet.
landing.lorem_ipsum: The Chilean Space Habitat project arises as a response to the challenge of designing a habitable system that allows human beings to live, work, and maintain their well-being in extreme conditions such as those on Mars.

app_header.title: CHILEANSPACE
app_header.high_radiation_desc: High radiation levels detected near Sector Gamma-7. EVA missions suspended.
app_header.supply_ship_desc: ESA supply ship is scheduled to arrive at Sol 345.
app_header.solar_flare_desc: Peak solar flare activity predicted for Sol 350. All external systems should be monitored.
app_header.system_maintenance_desc: ECLSS maintenance scheduled for tomorrow at 08:00 habitat time.

materials.title: Material Viewer
materials.select_material_desc: Select a material to see its details.
materials.select_material_prompt: Select a material to view details.
materials.tower_wall_desc: Detailed wall section, combining 3D printing with regolith, advanced insulation, and functional layers.
materials.tower_wall_details:
Wall Composition (Exterior to Interior)

  • Martian Soil (Compacted): The base on which it is built.
  • Regolith Berm (0.5–1.0 m): A loose earth barrier for additional protection against radiation and micrometeorites. Goal of 1-2 m for full protection.
  • Geopolymer Base Ring (f’c 20–40 MPa): The 3D printed foundation on which the shell sits, with fluorinated silicone joints to withstand low temperatures (–120 °C).
  • 1. Anti-Erosion Coating (Polyurea + IR): Protects the outer structure from wear caused by the Martian environment.
  • 2. Printed Shell (300–400 mm): The main body of the structure, made of geopolymer or sulfur concrete with basalt fiber reinforcement.
  • 3. Insulation (50–100 mm): Aerogel or basalt fiber panels for superior thermal control (U ≤ 0.25 W/m²K).
  • 4. Technical Cavity (80–120 mm): Space for wiring, pipes, and systems.
  • 5. Hermetic Liner (ETFE/Vectran + MLI): The main gas barrier to maintain internal atmospheric pressure (target airtightness n50 ≤ 0.3 h⁻¹).
  • 6. Interior Sandwich Panel: Honeycomb structure of Aluminum or CFRP (carbon fiber reinforced polymer) that forms the inner habitable wall.
  • Piezoelectric Skin: Hexagonal modules on the exterior for sensing and micro-energy generation.
materials.piezo_module_desc: Modular unit for the habitat's 'skin' that generates energy from pressure and vibration.
materials.piezo_module_details:
Module Design (250-300 mm side)

  • A) EDS Anti-Dust/Ice Film: A top layer with an electrodynamic Dust Removal System for self-cleaning.
  • B) Piezoelectric Material: PVDF-TrFE film or encapsulated PZT (Lead Zirconate Titanate) patches that convert pressure and vibration into electricity.
  • C) Substrate: Base of GFRP (Glass Fiber Reinforced Polymer) or a printed composite of Nylon and basalt.
  • D) Integrated Electronics: Includes an ASIC (Application-Specific Integrated Circuit), a current rectifier, and a supercapacitor for temporary energy storage.
  • E) Back Plate: Equipped with bayonet clips for quick installation and maintenance (hot-swap).

Performance and Specifications

  • Expected Output: 1–20 mW/m². Its primary use is for impact sensing, but it contributes to micro-energy generation.
  • Current Bus: Connects to a 12 V DC bus that runs around the structure in a ring.
  • Encapsulation: Protected with fluoropolymer (FEP/ETFE) resistant to UV radiation and dust.
materials.bom_desc: A summary of the primary materials used in the habitat's construction.
materials.bom_details:
Tower Wall

  • Printed shell: Geopolymer / Sulfur-concrete + Basalt fiber.
  • Insulation: Aerogel / Basalt fiber (50–100 mm).
  • Technical cavity: 80–120 mm space.
  • Hermetic liner: ETFE/Vectran + MLI (Multi-Layer Insulation).
  • Interior panel: Al/CFRP honeycomb sandwich.

Base and Environment

  • Base ring: Geopolymer (f’c 20–40 MPa strength).
  • Joints: Fluorinated silicone (resistant down to –120 °C).
  • Berm: Compacted Martian regolith (0.5–1.0 m).

Honeycomb Skin (Piezoelectric Module)

  • Substrate: GFRP / Nylon-basalt.
  • Active layer: PVDF-TrFE film or PZT patches.
  • Protective layer: EDS anti-dust/ice film.
  • Electronics: ASIC, rectifier, and supercapacitor.

oshi.title: OSHI Dashboard
oshi.subtitle: Occupational Space Health Index for all crew members.
oshi.roster_desc: Select a crew member to view their OSHI details.
oshi.select_prompt: Select a crew member to see their OSHI data.
oshi.dim_variety_desc: Diversity of activities and tasks performed.
oshi.dim_balance_desc: Equilibrium between active and passive tasks.
oshi.dim_circadian_desc: Alignment with the habitat's day/night cycle.
oshi.dim_sensory_desc: Time spent in environments with optimal sensory input.
oshi.dim_motivation_desc: Self-reported drive and physiological indicators of engagement.
oshi.dim_social_desc: Meaningful interaction with other crew members.
oshi.dim_meaningful_desc: Time dedicated to personally fulfilling activities.

analysis.event_sl_3: CO2 levels slightly elevated. Ventilation increased.
analysis.event_gh_1: Automated pollination cycle initiated in bay A.
analysis.alert_eclss_1: Oxygen generator B operating at 110% capacity.

analysis.event_stor_1: Rover-2 returned to bay for charging.
